hints.hint 1: Can you use something like: `fig, ((ax1, ax2), (ax3, ax4), ...`

There is no simpler way of doing this. You are required to store the dataframes as variables of the file names, e.g `annual_co2_africa.csv`'s data should be stored with the variable `annual_co2_africa`.
Recall that to plot multiple lines, you can apply the plot function twice e.g `plt.plot(...); plt.plot(...)`
hints.hint 2: To make the plot clearer, you can add a Legend, e.g: `plt.legend(['Africa', 'Asia','Americas', 'EU28', 'Europe(other)', 'China', 'India', 'US', 'Middle East', 'International Transport'])`
